bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

div1.p: This handwritten account of Reed's military history includes a listing of his military orders from 1875 through 1894. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Report on Walter Reed, [n.d.]
div1.p:
Mr. Roby:
so record on page 32 A.R. 1902, cauch?
OK W.G.
Died. Nov. 23, 1902, Wash D.C.

Mr. Hutman,
SGR
Dec 13/02

For statement of service & name of
nearest relative
W.G.

He was at Willets' Point N.Y.H. from July 26, 1875
to April 17, 1876. Enroute to San Francisco
Cal and accompanying troops to Fort Yuma
Cal to June 21, 1876, at Fort Yuma Cal to Aug 6
1876, at Camp Lowell, A.T. to Aug 7, 1877
at Fort Apache A.T. to May 10, 1880. awaiting orders to NYC 7/80 On
leave from June 8 to Aug 7, 1880. Awaiting
orders to Oct 1, 1880, At Fort Ontario, N.Y. to Feb.
24, 1881. At Fort McHenry, Md. to May 2, 1881.
At Wash. Bks D.C. to June 23, 1862. Post Surgeon
at Gaithersburg, Md. to Mar 2, 1882. Attending
Surgeon Hdqtrs Dept of the Platte to Jan 1,
1883, at Fort Omaha, Nebr. to Sept 29, 1883. Post
Surgeon at Fort Sidney Nebr. to Aug 4, 1884.
Post Surgeon at Fort Robinson, Nebr. to
July 31, 1887. Post surgeon at Mt. Vernon Bks.
Ala. to Sept 8, 1890. (Sick Jan 26-27 and June 28
to July 4, 1890) On leave Sept 8 to Oct 7, 1890.
Attending Surgeon and Examining Recruits at
Baltimore, Md. to Oct 7, 1891, except while
on temporary field service at Ft Keogh
Mont from Dec 16, 19890 to Feb 4 1891; On temp
duty at N.Y. City to Nov 7, 1891. At Ft. Snelling
to Aug 22, 1892. Attending Surgeon and Examining
Recruits at St. Paul, Minn. to Aug 28, 1893.
On duty in Surgeon Generals office
to date of death. Except while on D.Serv in Cuba
from March 7, 1900 to Feb 12, 1901.

Died at Wash. Barracks D.C.
Nov 23, 1902.
S.D.W.
2828. A.C.P. '75 Merit Roll candidates for appt. as Asst. Surg. U.S.A.
3208. " '75 S.O. 147. par 1. and 2. July 20/75 change of station

officers to report to Army Medical for Ex for pro

6386 " 85. Applies for four months leave Returned to C.G.

has arrived to relieve Patzki

17 " 90} Infy Reed sent to accompany him to Insane Asylum

services at Mt Vernon Bks during absence
of Reed.
